edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.www
Class WWWBackEndLSP

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.BackEndLSPAdapter
        |
        +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.www.WWWBackEndLSP
All Implemented Interfaces:
BackEndLSP
public class WWWBackEndLSP
extends BackEndLSPAdapter

The main class of the package. Provides a BackEndLSP wrapper for a collection accessible through web-based search engine.

A deployer of this class must be sure to write the following files: www_query.xsl, www_results.xsl, and meta_attributes.xml, and put them in the SDARTS_HOME/config/backEndLSPName directory. See the SDARTS README and Design Doc for more information about these files.

This class uses a WWWQueryProcessor to perform queries.

Standard initialization. Also, sets up the WWWQueryProcessor.

initialize in class BackEndLSPAdapter
Parameters:

description - description of the BackEndLSP

getContentSummary

public LSPContentSummary getContentSummary()
                                    throws BackEndException
Currently, there is no support for generating content summaries from a web-based collection, since most such collections do not offer that information. For a collection that does, the programmer should subclass this class and implement this method.
Returns:
null

getMetaAttributes

public LSPMetaAttributes getMetaAttributes()
                                    throws BackEndException
Retrieve the meta-attributes of the underlying subcollection. Note: unlike in other BackEndLSPs, the programmer/administrator must write their own meta_attributes.xml file; it is not automatically generated, as there is no way of telling from the remote web collection what the metadata is. This file goes in the SDARTS_HOME/config/backEndLSPName directory. Note also that this class uses the DocMetaAttributesBuilder to load the meta-attributes.
Returns:
the meta-attributes, formatted as an LSPMetaAttributes
Throws:
BackEndException - if something goes wrong
